means: 兴高采烈的，得意洋洋的

sentence.Network_en: For my part, I feel elated and close to tears.
sentence.Network_cn: 就我而言，我感到非常高兴，都快落泪了。

sentence.Network_en: They were elated at the result.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们对这一结果感到欢欣鼓舞。
她的成功使全家人兴高采烈.

list.abs: Like those of little experience , he was easily elated by success and deflated by failure ., 正如没经历过大事的人一样 , 他是经不起成功也经不起失败的.
The crowds in the square were elated by the news ., 这消息使广场上的人群欢欣鼓舞.

...小五趾跳鼠（学名：Allactaga elater）为跳鼠科五趾跳鼠属的动物。在中国大陆，分布于新疆等地，主要生活于荒漠、半荒漠。该物种的模式产地在哈萨克斯坦。==亚种==*小五趾跳鼠北疆亚种（学名：Allact.

entry.tran: 兴高采烈的;得意洋洋的
entry.def: If you are elated, you are extremely happy and excited because of something that has happened.

example.ex: I was elated that my second heart bypass had been successful...
example.tran: 第二次心脏搭桥手术成功了，我很高兴。

example.ex: 'That was one of the best races of my life,' said an elated Hakkinen.
example.tran: “那是我一生中表现最好的比赛之一，”哈基宁兴高采烈地说。

means.word_mean: 1. exultantly proud and joyful; in high spirits;

auth_sentence.content: Elated and understated; just the way we like it.

auth_sentence.content: I was greatly elated with my new command.

auth_sentence.content: Osama was elated to find that Muhannad had not suffered.

sentences.cn: 听到我们胜利了, 大家都感到欢欣鼓舞。
